column4: can someone help i have had this version of linux before and i could download google chrome but it says its not in the app store why?
because it doesn't conform to package guidelines
you can download it and install it from Google
it integrates with the store after you've downloaded it from Google too
you do know that Chromium is the open source project Google Chrome is based on right?
if you install Chromium, you have Chrome without the proprietary bits
it's there on my search results.  What version of Ubuntu are you using? :|
you need to install a newer version
that version is past End of Life
8.04 doesn't get patches/updates or support for desktop use any more, you need to update to 10.04
that may explain the lack of a search result
the version numbers are based on the year and month of release by the way :)
technically yes, but I don't recommend it
if you're gonna change version, just grab 12.04.  It has 5 years of support lifetime :D
it won't need an upgrade until April 2017 if you use 12.04 ;)
